p: EOs from the three Nectandra species showed antibacterial activity against both E. coli and S. aureus. We observed that E. coli was more vulnerable to the EOs from N. megapotamica, whereas S. aureus was more susceptible to the EOs from N. lanceolata, regardless of the season of the year in which the leaves were harvested ( Table 2). The lowest MIC for E. coli was observed when the bacteria were exposed to the EOs from the leaves of N. megapotamica harvested in winter.
